AP/ADMS 2320.title: Business Statistics
AP/ADMS 2320.Prerequisites: Prerequisites: AP/ADMS 1000 3.00; one 12U mathematics course or equivalent. Course credit exclusion: AP/ECON 2500 3.00.

AP/ADMS 2400.title: Introduction to Organizational Behaviour
AP/ADMS 2400.Prerequisites: Prerequisites: AP/ADMS 1000 3.00 and AP/ADMS1010 3.00; For students in the BHRM program, AP/HRM1000. For BDEM and BPA students, AP/ADMS 1000 3.00. Course credit exclusion: HH/PSYC 3570 3.00.

AP/ADMS 2510.title: Introduction to Management Accounting
AP/ADMS 2510.Prerequisites: Prerequisites: 1) AP/ECON 1000 3.00; 2) AP/ADMS 2500 3.00 and 3) AP/ADMS 2320 3.00. Course credit exclusions: AP/ADMB 2510 3.00, AP/ADMS 1500 3.00, AP/ADMS 1550 3.00, GL/ECON 2720 3.00.

AP/ADMS 2511.title: Management Information Systems
AP/ADMS 2511.Prerequisites: Prerequisite: AP/ADMS 1000 3.00. Course credit exclusion: AP/ADMB 2511 3.00.

AP/ADMS 2600.title: Human Resources Management
AP/ADMS 2600.Prerequisites: Prerequisite: AP/ADMS 1000 3.00 (students in the BCOM/BHRM programs, the HRM Certificate or the HRM Minor may take AP/ADMS 1000 3.00 concurrently with AP/ADMS/HRM 2600 3.00). Prior TO FALL 2009: Prerequisite: AK/ADMS 1000 3.00 (students in the BCOM/BHRM programs may take AK/ADMS 1000 3.00 concurrently with AK/ADMS 2600 3.00). Course credit exclusions: AK/ADMS 2600 3.00, AK/ADMS 3480 3.00 (prior to Summer 2001).

AP/ADMS 2610.title: Elements of Law: Part One
AP/ADMS 2610.Prerequisites: Prerequisite: AP/ADMS 1000 3.00. PRIOR TO FALL 2013: Course credit exclusion: AP/POLS 3165 6.00.

AP/ADMS 3000.title: Directed Reading
AP/ADMS 3000.Prerequisites: Prerequisites: 78 credits including AP/ADMS 1000 3.00, AP/ECON 1000 3.00, AP/ECON 1010 3.00, and six credits in management science, or, for students with equivalent preparation, permission of the Director of the School of Administrative Studies. Note: Students must be accepted by a faculty supervisor before they can register in this course. The course transaction form for such courses must be submitted with a note from the supervisor stating his/her willingness to perform this task. Permission of the Director of the School of Administrative Studies is also required.

AP/ADMS 3015.title: Professional Communication in the Canadian Context

AP/ADMS 3020.title: Canadian Business Culture and Management Skills
AP/ADMS 3020.Prerequisites: Prerequisite: Score of 5.5 on YELT or equivalent. Course credit exclusions: AP/ADMS 1000 3.00, AP/ADMS 2400 3.00, AP/ADMS 3040 3.00, AP/ADMS 3930 3.00, AP/HRM 3440 3.00.

AP/ADMS 3210.title: Consumer Behaviour
AP/ADMS 3210.Prerequisites: Prerequisites: 1) For students in an Honours program, AP/ADMS 2200 3.00, or 2) other students, a grade of C+ or better in AP/ADMS 2200 3.00. Course credit exclusion: AP/ADMS 4220 3.00 (prior to Fall 2012).

AP/ADMS 3220.title: Applied Marketing Management
AP/ADMS 3220.Prerequisites: Prerequisites: 1) For students in an Honours program AP/ADMS 2200 3.00, or 2) other students, a grade of C+ or better in AP/ADMS 2200 3.00.

AP/ADMS 3330.title: Introduction to Management Science
AP/ADMS 3330.Prerequisites: Prerequisite: AP/ADMS 2320 3.00. Course credit exclusion: AP/ADMB 3330 3.00.

AP/ADMS 3352.title: Sampling Techniques and Survey Design
AP/ADMS 3352.Prerequisites: Prerequisite: AP/ECON 2500 3.00 or AP/ADMS 2320 3.00, or, for students with equivalent preparation, permission of the coordinator. Note: This course counts as an elective in an economics major.

AP/ADMS 3400.title: Occupational Health and Safety
AP/ADMS 3400.Prerequisites: Prerequisite: AP/ADMS 1000 3.00, for all BCOM and BCOM Honours students. Prior TO FALL 2009: Prerequisite: AK/ADMS 1000 3.00, for all BCOM and BCOM Honours students. Course credit exclusions: AK/ADMS 3400 3.00, AK/HLST 3240 3.00 prior to F/W 2008.
